thread.title: RC Cola overpowers Meralco in PSL tilt
thread.title_full: RC Cola overpowers Meralco in PSL tilt | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Kristel Satumbaga
title: RC Cola overpowers Meralco in PSL tilt
text:
by Kristel Satumbaga
October 16, 2015 Games Tomorrow
(Cuneta Astrodome)
1 p.m. – Cignal vs Meralco
3 p.m. – Philips Gold vs Petron
It was not a flying start but RC Cola-Air Force was still thrilled to win its opening match in the 2015 Philippine Superliga (PSL) Grand Prix women’s volleyball tournament yesterday.
With Puerto Rican import Lynda Morales at the helm, the Raiders hacked out a hard-earned 25-20, 17-25, 20-25, 25-21, 15-13 victory over the Meralco Power Spikers at The Arena in San Juan City.
Morales charmed the crowd not only with her good looks but also with her power plays to finish with 26 points on 19 kills and seven blocks.
Sar McClinton, another foreign reinforcement, also stepped up for RC Cola with 20 points highlighted by 16 attacks, even as Iari Yongco chipped in seven points.
The Raiders took the first set with little problem but found themselves in delicate situation after losing the next two sets.
Through the inspired performance of Morales, the Raiders got their rhythm back in the fourth frame that enabled them to even up matters at 2-set all.
They surged ahead 12-8 in the deciding fifth set but the Power Spikers rallied behind the efforts of Cha Cruz and guest player Liis Kullerkann to tie the count at 12-all.
Again, the Raiders went to Morales and the hard-hitting import responded with two booming spikes to break the standoff.
The Raiders then sailed the win when Cruz bungled on her next play that sparked a wild celebration.
While RC Cola Coach Rhovyl Verayo was pleased with their opening game victory, he said they have to improve in some aspects of the game to be certified title contenders.
“First-game jitters,” said Verayo. “Pero simula pa naman ito. May room for improvement pa naman.”
Kullerkann posted 18 points, 15 coming from attacks, for Meralco, which absorbed its third straight defeat in as many outings.
